greeting: My name is Paul and I bid you welcome to my Portfolio!
about-content: I am a student pursuing the Computer Network System master at Universit√© Paris-Saclay. I am particularly interested in Networks and Systems administration aswell as biology.
knowledge-content-1: My Master's Degree focuses on Networks and Administration, as such I have learned to set-up and care for servers and networks. I have also learned the basics of Advanced mathematics, opto-electronics and Statistics. Alongside, I have learned to code and I am proficient in Python for Scripting.
knowledge-content-2: Here is a list of the technologies my Uni cursus taught me:

projects.title: My projects
projects.intro: For the past two years, a great part of our teachings were done with projects. I also got the chance to participate in the Synthetic Biology Competition IGEM.

igem.title: IGEM
igem.intro: I was approached by a member of the IGEM team for our Uni to help with the project. And so i got to design and code our Wiki
igem.project-description: Our project was about improving Carbon Fixation in cyanobacteria
igem.award: At the Grand Jamboree we were nominated for Best New Basic Part and received a Gold Medal
igem.future: I will be participating again for the next edition and i hope to do more for the team.
igem.impact: This project awoke an interest for biology I didn't know I had, and as such I have started learning more about BioInformatics in hope to branch out.

uni.title: Uni
uni.intro: Here are some of the project we had the past two years

rwg.title: Read-Write-Grow Hackaton
rwg.description: Friends from the IGEM team suggested we should participate to this hackaton, so we formed two teams. We focused on predicting and designing RNA nanocages. I personally worked on processing the RNA and predicting the secondary structure.
rwg.outcome: Although we did not win, our sister team was amongst the top ten and got to pitch their idea to professionals and receive guidance.

cardihack.title: Cardi-Hack Challenge
cardihack.description: Suggested to me by a friend studying BioInformatics, this challenge is about training a Language-Model to compute PRS-scores and evaluate cardiac risks.

server.title: My Server
server.description: I build myself a server using Unraid and Docker
